meanings.definition: To make something unoriginal or trite.
meanings.sent1: She kept banalizing her stories by always using the same cliches.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes were banalizing, lacking any originality.
meanings.sent3: His constant use of banalizing phrases made his friends roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The artist felt like banalizing her work was equivalent to selling out.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned against banalizing their essays with overused expressions.

meanings.definition: To reduce the impact or significance of something by making it commonplace.
meanings.sent1: The constant repetition of the advertisement was banalizing the product.
meanings.sent2: The repeated exposure to violence on TV was banalizing the viewers' reactions.
meanings.sent3: The way he casually mentioned the tragic event was almost banalizing it.
meanings.sent4: The politician's empty promises were banalizing the concept of change.
meanings.sent5: The overuse of special effects was banalizing the impact of the movie.
